data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Don't pass CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE if it isn't set (#24)

Should eliminate a build warning on Windows, where the build type isn't
specified using CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Bump external project's cmake version to avoid warnings (#24)

There is no reason for the external project's minimum CMake version to
be less than the vendor package's cmake version. This should help avoid
some CMake warnings.

Signed-off-by: Scott K Logan <logans@cottsay.net>

data.author: Steven! Ragnarök
data.message:
Try to find Config package in TinyXML Module file. (Take 2) (#4)

* Try to find Config package in TinyXML Module file.

Seeing Dirk bring in this line from the CMake docs out of context

> If no module is found and the MODULE option is not given the
> command proceeds to Config mode.

Made me realize that "If no module is found" might mean "If no module
file is found" rather than "If no package is found with the module
files." which was my assumption from reading the docs previously.

Using tinyxml_vendor declaratively is nice for packages that rely on
it but it means that the entire burden of coordinating lies within the
package. I think it'd be easier if packages tried to resolve TinyXML
and only pulled in tinyxml_vendor as a last resort. It would simplify
tinyxml_vendor and cut down on special cases. But if this attempt
is successful, it might be fine.

* Silence package not found warning.

Not finding a package at this step is fine on most systems. Because we're defining a module finder we do need to explicitly try to find a config package in case the local machine is using the CMake package registry.
